Package environment

Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • environment.Main
  • public class Main
extends javafx.application.Application
    Main class hosting the javafx Application. Gets called on start of the program and is the base for the javafx application. Builds the stage (window) with some basic setup like FullScreen-Mode or the scrollbar along with its calculations. In addition, this class provides the program with some basic layouts like the headline font fHeadline. Ultimately, Homepage gets called.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Wolkenfarmer

    • Field Detail

      • scene

        static javafx.scene.Scene scene
        The Scene for the start(Stage).
        See Also:
        Javafx Application basic structure

      • sbRoot

        static javafx.scene.Group sbRoot
        Layout-group to contains the scrollbar and start up the scene. This layout-group need to be seperate from root, because root gets moved along it's y-axis while scrolling / using the scrollbar, while the scrollbar itself should not move in sbRoot.
        See Also:
        Javafx Application basic structure

      • root

        static javafx.scene.Group root
        Layout-group to contain the content of the pages (like Homepage). This layout-group need to be seperate from sbRoot, because root gets moved along it's y-axis while scrolling / using the scrollbar, while the scrollbar itself should not move in sbRoot.

      • scrollbar

        static javafx.scene.control.ScrollBar scrollbar
        The scrollbar for all pages nested in sbRoot. EventHandler and Listener with its calculations are in start(Stage).

      • dummyScene

        static javafx.scene.Scene dummyScene
        A dummyScene in order to calculate the dimensions of layout objects while building. The scene gets connected with dummyRoot in start(Stage). This scene is needed for calcHeight(Region) and calcHeightLabel(Label, double) in order to be able to applyCSS and layout() the given objects without having to attach them to scene where the entire page is added to.

      • dummyRoot

        static javafx.scene.Group dummyRoot
        A dummyRoot for the dummyScene in order to calculate the dimensions of layout objects while building. This is needed to setup the scene.

      • stageHeight

        static double stageHeight
        Reference to the window-height for the entire program. This useful for the layout-calculations of the pages' contents.

      • stageWidth

        static double stageWidth
        Reference to the window-width for the entire program. This useful for the layout-calculations of the pages' contents.

      • contentHeight

        static double contentHeight
        Describes the height of content of each page. This value gets calculated / get overwritten for each page in order for the scrollbar to compute its movement space correctly.

      • input

        static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> input
        Input handling. This ArrayList gets filled / used in start(Stage) by the scene listeners. In this scene it's only used for a short cut to close the program (Esc).

      • fHeadline

        static javafx.scene.text.Font fHeadline
        Unified referenceable font for layouts.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method of the program calling launch. Starts the application by calling launch(args) which calls up start.
        Parameters:
        args - Used for calling launch (javafx Application)
        See Also:
        Javafx Application documentation, start(Stage)

      • start

        public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        (Builds) and starts the javafx application. Sets up the stage and links it up to the scene. Both are modified with some basic setup like FullScreen-Mode or the scrollbar (which gets added via sbRoot to the scene). In addition, the keyboard and scrollbar listeners are written here and added to the scene. Lastly, Homepage gets called.
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        Parameters:
        stage - Makes up the window and is required for a javafx application.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        Javafx Application start() documentation

      • calcHeight

        public static double calcHeight​(javafx.scene.layout.Region r)
        Calculates the Height of a given Region. JavaFX layout calculations just work by applying CSS and a layout pass, which occures usually after a page is finished building. Therefore, the region gets temporarily attached to dummyScene (instead of scene) in order to get the height before the page is finished building. This is necessary because the height is relevant to continue building the page.
        Parameters:
        r - The region (or subclass of it) of which the height gets calculated.
        Returns:
        Returns the height of the region.

      • calcHeightLabel

        public static double calcHeightLabel​(javafx.scene.control.Label l,
                                     double parentWidth)
        Calculates the Height of a given Label. JavaFX layout calculations just work by applying CSS and a layout pass, which occures usually after a page is finished building. Therefore, the label gets temporarily attached to dummyScene (instead of scene) in order to get the height before the page is finished building. For this to work firstly the width of the label with its content gets calculated and then divided by the parent Objects width to get the number of lines. Then the height of one individual line gets muliplied with it. In addition, an approximation for the distance of each line gets added. This is necessary because the height is relevant to continue building the page.

        Note: This calculation is _not_ exact and is based on approximations, because neither the insets nor the padding of the parent or the label give back the exact spacing between them. Ultimately, there is no known way to get the spacing between each individual line in pixel depending on it's size.

        Parameters:
        l - The label of which the height gets calculated.
        parentWidth - The width of the parent object in order to calculate the nubmer of lines.
        Returns:
        Returns the height of a label
